column4: i can't access the gui of my linux desktop at my college as it's banned by the admin. How are they doing it?
Port blocked in firewall maybe? Care to tell us how you access the desktop normally?
you are not trying to access it remotely? you are physically sitting by your own desktop computer, and you cannot get a GUI up?
yeah we access it remotely from the server computer
we just login with our userid and passwd and it logins remotely from the server.
you there?
yes
any idea about solving my problem?
You should take this up with your admin if he has blocked access to your desktop
ok.. one more thing is that many commands like cp are unable to be used. It seems the admin has blocked it. How can are they able to block a particular commands?
they can set privileges on executable files to disallow execution. This has little to do with ubuntu really
Do a "ls -al /bin/cp" and give us output
i haven tried. Now I'm at not at colge.
It sounds like you tried to copy a file which you do not have permission to read... not that the actual cp command is not executable for you
okay.. i think they have removed the permissin for me to run the exectuable of cp as it's not even workin on the files I creatted
okay, reset the permissions and you should be fine
i am not the admin. I can't do it :(
if you are not the admin, then you could not possibly have messed up the permissions in the first place
i am not the one who messed up the permissions. admin intentionally did it for avoid using the cp command :)
no way to bypass it ?? :)
No, consult your admin
okay.. thanks
